objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Software code execution
objects.description: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Software could allow a local authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the lack of authentication to the IPC listener. By sending specially-crafted IPC messages to the AnyConnect client IPC listener, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the targeted AnyConnect user.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-anyconnect-ipc-KfQO9QhK for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
x_xfe_platforms_affected: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Linux
Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows
Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for MacOS

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the interprocess communication (IPC) channel of Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to cause a targeted AnyConnect user to execute a malicious script. The vulnerability is due to a lack of authentication to the IPC listener. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted IPC messages to the AnyConnect client IPC listener. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to cause the targeted AnyConnect user to execute a script. This script would execute with the privileges of the targeted AnyConnect user. In order to successfully exploit this vulnerability, there must be an ongoing AnyConnect session by the targeted user at the time of the attack. To exploit this vulnerability, the attacker would also

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and Cisco Webex Player code execution
objects.description: Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and Cisco Webex Player could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by insufficient validation of certain elements of a Webex recording. By persuading a victim to open a specially crafted file, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-webex-nbr-NOS6FQ24 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and Cisco Webex Player Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerabilities

Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Webex Network Recording Player for Windows and Cisco Webex Player for Windows could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected system. The vulnerabilities are due to insufficient validation of certain elements of a Webex recording that is stored in the Advanced Recording Format (ARF) or Webex Recording Format (WRF). An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a user a malicious ARF or WRF file through a link or email attachment and persuading the user to open the file with the affected software on the local system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected system with the privileges of the targeted user.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and Cisco Webex Player code execution
objects.description: Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and Cisco Webex Player could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by insufficient validation of certain elements of a Webex recording. By persuading a victim to open a specially crafted file, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-webex-nbr-NOS6FQ24 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and Cisco Webex Player Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerabilities

Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Webex Network Recording Player for Windows and Cisco Webex Player for Windows could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected system. The vulnerabilities are due to insufficient validation of certain elements of a Webex recording that is stored in the Advanced Recording Format (ARF) or Webex Recording Format (WRF). An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a user a malicious ARF or WRF file through a link or email attachment and persuading the user to open the file with the affected software on the local system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected system with the privileges of the targeted user.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN Software privilege escalation
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow a local authenticated attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by improper input validation. By sending a specially-crafted request to a utility, an authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain root privileges.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vepescm-BjgQm4vJ for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

A vulnerability in Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to elevate privileges to root on the underlying operating system. The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted request to a utility that is running on an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to gain root privileges.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN Software denial of service
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper input validation for specific commands. By sending a specially-crafted arguments, a local authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to create or overwrite arbitrary files resulting in a denial of service condition.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vsoln-arbfile-gtsEYxns for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software Arbitrary File Creation Vulnerability

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN Software privilege escalation
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow a local authenticated attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by improper permissions being set when command is executed. By executing a specially-crafted command, an <authenticated> attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain root privileges.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vepegr-4xynYLUj for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

A vulnerability in Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to elevate privileges to root group on the underlying operating system. The vulnerability is due to incorrect permissions being set when the affected command is executed. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by executing the affected command on an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to gain root privileges.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and Cisco Webex Player code execution

By persuading a victim to open a specially crafted file, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and Cisco Webex Player Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerabilities

Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Webex Network Recording Player for Windows and Cisco Webex Player for Windows could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected system. The vulnerabilities are due to insufficient validation of certain elements of a Webex recording that is stored in the Advanced Recording Format (ARF) or Webex Recording Format (WRF). An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a user a malicious ARF or WRF file through a link or email attachment and persuading the user to open the file with the affected software on the local system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected system with the privileges of the targeted user.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco IP Phones denial of service
objects.description: Cisco IP Phones is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper TCP ingress packet rate limiting. By sending specially-crafted TCP traffic, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the phone to reload.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-voip-phone-flood-dos-YnU9EXOv for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
x_xfe_platforms_affected: Cisco Unified IP Conference Phone 8831 for Third-Party Call Control
Cisco IP Phone 8811 Desktop Phones with Multiplatform Firmware
Cisco IP Phone 8841 Desktop Phones with Multiplatform Firmware
Cisco IP Phone 8851 Desktop Phones with Multiplatform Firmware
Cisco IP Phone 8861 Desktop Phones with Multiplatform Firmware
Cisco IP DECT 210 Multi-Cell Base Station with Multiplatform Firmware
Cisco IP DECT 6825 with Multiplatform Firmware

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco IP Phone TCP Packet Flood Denial of Service Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the TCP packet processing functionality of Cisco IP Phones could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the phone to stop responding to incoming calls, drop connected calls, or unexpectedly reload. The vulnerability is due to insufficient TCP ingress packet rate limiting. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a high and sustained rate of crafted TCP traffic to the targeted device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to impact operations of the phone or cause the phone to reload, leading to a denial of service (DoS) condition.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco IOS XR Software code execution
objects.description: Cisco IOS XR Software could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error in the enhanced Preboot eXecution Environment (PXE) boot loader. By replacing a valid software image with a malicious one, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-iosxr-pxe-unsign-code-exec-qAa78fD2 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco IOS XR Software Enhanced Preboot eXecution Environment Unsigned Code Execution Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the enhanced Preboot eXecution Environment (PXE) boot loader for Cisco IOS XR 64-bit Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute unsigned code during the PXE boot process on an affected device. The PXE boot loader is part of the BIOS and runs over the management interface of hardware platforms that are running Cisco IOS XR Software only. The vulnerability exists because internal commands that are issued when the PXE network boot process is loading a software image are not properly verified. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by compromising the PXE boot server and replacing a valid software image with a malicious one. Alternatively, the attacker could impersonate the PXE boot server and send a PXE boot reply with a malicious file. A succ

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software privilege escalation
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow a local authenticated attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by improper validation of path input to the system file transfer functions. By sending specially-crafted requests using path variables, an authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overwrite arbitrary files are gain elevated privileges.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vmanage-escalation-Jhqs5Skf for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Webex Meetings Desktop App for Windows code execution
objects.description: Cisco Webex Meetings Desktop App for Windows could allow a local authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper messages validation. By sending specially-crafted messages using the virtualization channel interface, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of a targeted user.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-webex-vdi-qQrpBwuJ for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
x_xfe_platforms_affected: Cisco Webex Meetings Virtual Desktop Software for Windows

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Webex Meetings Desktop App Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability

A vulnerability in virtualization channel messaging in Cisco Webex Meetings Desktop App for Windows could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code on a targeted system. This vulnerability occurs when this app is deployed in a virtual desktop environment and using virtual environment optimization. This vulnerability is due to improper validation of messages processed by the Cisco Webex Meetings Desktop App. A local attacker with limited privileges could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious messages to the affected software by using the virtualization channel interface. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to modify the underlying operating system configuration, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of a targeted user. Note:

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software directory traversal
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system, caused by improper validation of user request to application programmatic interfaces (APIs). An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to gain access to sensitive information.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vman-traversal-hQh24tmk for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software Directory Traversal Vulnerability

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Webex Teams cross-site scripting
objects.description: Cisco Webex Teams is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the usernames. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-webex-teams-xss-zLW9tD3 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN Software privilege escalation
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow a local authenticated attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by improper security controls on the CLI. By sending a specially-crafted request using the CLI utility, an authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain root privileges.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vepeshlg-tJghOQcA for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

A vulnerability in Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to elevate privileges to root on the underlying operating system. The vulnerability is due to insufficient security controls on the CLI. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by using an affected CLI utility that is running on an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to gain root privileges.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software cross-site scripting
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vmxss2-NL4KSSVR for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface. The vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the interface or access sensitive, browser-based information.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN vManage cross-site scripting
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vmanxsshi-9KHEqRpM for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the interface or access sensitive, browser-based information.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN Software privilege escalation
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow a local authenticated attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by improper input validation. By sending specially-crafted options to a specific command, an authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain root privileges.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vepestd-8C3J9Vc for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

A vulnerability in Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to elevate privileges to root on the underlying operating system. The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by providing crafted options to a specific command. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to gain root privileges.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software security bypass
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow a remote authenticated attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper authorization validation. By sending specially-crafted HTTP requests to the web-based management interface, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the configuration.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vmanuafw-ZHkdGGEy for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to bypass authorization and modify the configuration of an affected system. The vulnerability is due to insufficient authorization checking on an affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP requests to the web-based management interface of an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to gain privileges beyond what would normally be authorized for their configured user authorization level. This could allow the attacker to modify the configuration of an affected system.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software security bypass
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow a remote authenticated attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper handling of XML External Entity (XXE) entries. By persuading a victim to open specially-crafted XML content, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read and write files on the system.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vmanx2-KpFVSUc for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software XML External Entity Vulnerability

The vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the interface or access sensitive, browser-based information.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Identity Services Engine privilege escalation
objects.description: Cisco Identity Services Engine could allow a local authenticated attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by incorrect privilege assignment. By logging into the system with a specially crafted Active Directory account, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain root privileges.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-ise-priv-esc-fNZX8hHj for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Identity Services Engine Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the Microsoft Active Directory integration of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an authenticated, local attacker to elevate privileges on an affected device. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to have a valid administrator account on an affected device. The vulnerability is due to incorrect privilege assignment. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by logging in to the system with a crafted Active Directory account. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to obtain root privileges on an affected device.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco TelePresence Collaboration Endpoint Software information disclosure
objects.description: Cisco TelePresence Collaboration Endpoint Software could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper storage of sensitive information. By sending a specially crafted request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-tele-info-DrEGLpDQ for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco TelePresence Collaboration Endpoint Software Information Disclosure Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the video endpoint API (xAPI) of Cisco TelePresence Collaboration Endpoint (CE) Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to gain access to sensitive information on an affected device. The vulnerability is due to improper storage of sensitive information on an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by accessing information that should not be accessible to users with low privileges. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to gain access to sensitive information.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Identity Services Engine cross-site scripting
objects.description: Cisco Identity Services Engine is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-ise-xss-euRCwX9 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface of an affected device. The vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of an affected interface to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected interface or access sensitive, browser-based information.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Edge Fog Fabric security bypass
objects.description: Cisco Edge Fog Fabric could allow a remote authenticated attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by incorrect authorization enforcement. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overwrite arbitrary files.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-eff-incperm-9E6h4yBz for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Edge Fog Fabric Resource Exposure Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the REST API of Cisco Edge Fog Fabric could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to access files outside of their authorization sphere on an affected device. The vulnerability is due to incorrect authorization enforcement on an affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the API. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to overwrite arbitrary files on the affected device.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Identity Services Engine cross-site scripting
objects.description: Cisco Identity Services Engine is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-ise-xxs-pkjCmq9d for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker with administrative credentials to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface. The vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting malicious code into specific pages of the interface. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the interface or access sensitive, browser-based information. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to have valid administrative credentials.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Integrated Management Controller information disclosure
objects.description: Cisco Integrated Management Controller could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by differences in authentication responses sent back from the application as part of an authentication attempt. By sending a specially crafted request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-cimc-enum-CyheP3B7 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service denial of service
objects.description: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper handling of login requests. By sending a specially crafted request, a remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the device to restart.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-imp-dos-uTx2dqu2 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
x_xfe_platforms_affected: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service Denial of Service Vulnerability

A vulnerability in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service (Unified CM IM&P) Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to cause the Cisco XCP Authentication Service on an affected device to restart, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition. The vulnerability is due to improper handling of login requests. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted client login request to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause a process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition for new login attempts. Users who are authenticated at the time of the attack would not be affected. There are workarounds that address this vulnerability.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software command execution
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow a local authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper validation of commands to the remote management CLI. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the system.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vmanage-privilege-zPmMf73k for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software Command Injection Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the remote management feature of Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to inject arbitrary commands and potentially gain elevated privileges. The vulnerability is due to improper validation of commands to the remote management CLI of the affected application. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious requests to the affected application. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to inject arbitrary commands and potentially gain elevated privileges.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software security bypass
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow a remote authenticated attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper handling of XML external entity (XXE) declarations. By persuading a victim to open specially-crafted XML content, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to o read and write files on the system.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vmanx3-vrZbOqqD for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software XML External Entity Vulnerability

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.  When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate will be provided.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software directory traversal
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow a remote authenticated attacker to traverse directories on the system, caused by improper validation of requests to APIs. An attacker could send a specially crafted API to write arbitrary files on the system.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-vmanage-file-Y2JSRNRb for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software Arbitrary File Creation Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the application data endpoints of Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to write arbitrary files to an affected system. The vulnerability is due to improper validation of requests to APIs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious requests to an API within the affected application. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to conduct directory traversal attacks and write files to an arbitrary location on the targeted system.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Email Security Appliance security bypass
objects.description: Cisco Email Security Appliance could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper handling of password-protected zip files. By sending a malicious file inside a crafted zip-compressed file, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass configured content filters.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-esa-zip-bypass-gbU4gtTg for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Email Security Appliance Zip Content Filter Bypass Vulnerability

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.  When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate will be provided.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Integrated Management Controller security bypass
objects.description: Cisco Integrated Management Controller could allow a remote authenticated attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper authorization checks on API endpoints. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to download files from or modify limited configuration options.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-cimc-auth-zWkppJxL for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Integrated Management Controller Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.  When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate will be provided.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco Integrated Management Controller command execution
objects.description: Cisco Integrated Management Controller could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by insufficient input validation. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the system.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-CIMC-CIV-pKDBe9x5 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco Integrated Management Controller Command Injection Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the web UI of Cisco Integrated Management Controller (IMC) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary code and execute arbitrary commands at the underlying operating system level. The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted commands to the web-based management interface of the affected software. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to inject and execute arbitrary commands at the underlying operating system level.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows information disclosure
objects.description: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows could allow a local authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an exposed IPC function. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-anyconnect-file-read-LsvDD6Uh for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
x_xfe_platforms_affected: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the interprocess communication (IPC) channel of Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows could allow an authenticated, local attacker to read arbitrary files on the underlying operating system of an affected device. The vulnerability is due to an exposed IPC function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted IPC message to the AnyConnect process on an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to read arbitrary files on the underlying operating system of the affected device.

objects.name: Vulnerability Report for Cisco SD-WAN Software security bypass
objects.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper traffic filtering conditions. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass the L3 and L4 traffic filters and inject an arbitrary packet into the network.
objects.x_xfe_remedy: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-cedge-filt-bypass-Y6wZMqm4 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

x_xfe_references.description: Cisco SD-WAN Software Packet Filtering Bypass Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the packet filtering features of Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass L3 and L4 traffic filters. The vulnerability is due to improper traffic filtering conditions on an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious TCP packet with specific characteristics and sending it to a targeted device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass the L3 and L4 traffic filters and inject an arbitrary packet into the network.

objects.name: Cisco Security Advisories - November
objects.description:
# Summary

Cisco has published thirty-five Security Advisories. Of the advisories, twelve are rated as High, and twenty-three are rated as Medium.

# Threat Type

- Vulnerability

# Overview

Cisco has published thirty-five Security Advisories. Of the advisories, twelve are rated as High, and twenty-three are rated as Medium. For the vulnerability (CVE-2020-3556) addressed in the advisory, cisco-sa-anyconnect-ipc-KfQO9QhK, which applies to the AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client, Cisco notes it is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available. It is noted in all other advisories listed below that "The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory."

## Advisories Rated High

**AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-anyconnect-ipc-KfQO9QhK - CVE-2020-3556
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-anyconnect-ipc-KfQO9QhK 

**IOS XR Software Enhanced Preboot eXecution Environment Unsigned Code Execution Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-iosxr-pxe-unsign-code-exec-qAa78fD2 - CVE-2020-3284
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-iosxr-pxe-unsign-code-exec-qAa78fD2 

**Webex Meetings Desktop App Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-webex-vdi-qQrpBwuJ - CVE-2020-3588
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-webex-vdi-qQrpBwuJ 

**Webex Network Recording Player and Webex Player Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerabilities**
cisco-sa-webex-nbr-NOS6FQ24 - CVE-2020-3573, CVE-2020-3603, CVE-2020-3604
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-webex-nbr-NOS6FQ24 

**SD-WAN Software Arbitrary File Creation Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vsoln-arbfile-gtsEYxns - CVE-2020-26071
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vsoln-arbfile-gtsEYxns 

**IP Phone TCP Packet Flood Denial of Service Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-voip-phone-flood-dos-YnU9EXOv - CVE-2020-3574
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-voip-phone-flood-dos-YnU9EXOv 

**SD-WAN vManage Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vmanage-escalation-Jhqs5Skf - CVE-2020-26074
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmanage-escalation-Jhqs5Skf 

**SD-WAN vManage Software Directory Traversal Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vman-traversal-hQh24tmk - CVE-2020-26073
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vman-traversal-hQh24tmk 

**SD-WAN Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vepestd-8C3J9Vc - CVE-2020-3594
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vepestd-8C3J9Vc 

**SD-WAN Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vepeshlg-tJghOQcA - CVE-2020-3600
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vepeshlg-tJghOQcA 

**SD-WAN Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vepescm-BjgQm4vJ - CVE-2020-3593
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vepescm-BjgQm4vJ 

**SD-WAN Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vepegr-4xynYLUj - CVE-2020-3595
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vepegr-4xynYLUj 

## Advisories Rated Medium

**Integrated Management Controller Command Injection Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-CIMC-CIV-pKDBe9x5 - CVE-2020-3371
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-CIMC-CIV-pKDBe9x5 

**Webex Teams Web Interface Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-webex-teams-xss-zLW9tD3 - CVE-2020-26067
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-webex-teams-xss-zLW9tD3 

**SD-WAN vManage Software Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vmxss2-NL4KSSVR - CVE-2020-3579
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmxss2-NL4KSSVR 

**SD-WAN vManage Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vmanxsshi-9KHEqRpM - CVE-2020-3591
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmanxsshi-9KHEqRpM 

**SD-WAN vManage Software Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability**

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmanxss2-ugJyqxWF

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmanx3-vrZbOqqD 

**SD-WAN vManage Software XML External Entity Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vmanx2-KpFVSUc - CVE-2020-26064
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmanx2-KpFVSUc 

**SD-WAN vManage Software Authorization Bypass Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vmanuafw-ZHkdGGEy - CVE-2020-3592
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmanuafw-ZHkdGGEy 

**SD-WAN vManage Software Path Traversal Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vmanpt2-FqLuefsS - CVE-2020-26065
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmanpt2-FqLuefsS 

**SD-WAN vManage Software Command Injection Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vmanage-privilege-zPmMf73k - CVE-2020-27129
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmanage-privilege-zPmMf73k 

**SD-WAN vManage Software Arbitrary File Creation Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-vmanage-file-Y2JSRNRb - CVE-2020-27128
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-vmanage-file-Y2JSRNRb 

**TelePresence Collaboration Endpoint Software Information Disclosure Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-tele-info-DrEGLpDQ - CVE-2020-26086
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-tele-info-DrEGLpDQ 

**Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-ise-xxs-pkjCmq9d - CVE-2020-26083
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ise-xxs-pkjCmq9d 

**Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-ise-xss-euRCwX9 - CVE-2020-3551
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ise-xss-euRCwX9 

**Identity Services Engine Privilege Escalation Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-ise-priv-esc-fNZX8hHj - CVE-2020-27122
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ise-priv-esc-fNZX8hHj 

**Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service Denial of Service Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-imp-dos-uTx2dqu2 - CVE-2020-27121
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-imp-dos-uTx2dqu2 

**Email Security Appliance Zip Content Filter Bypass Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-esa-zip-bypass-gbU4gtTg - CVE-2020-26082
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-esa-zip-bypass-gbU4gtTg 

**Edge Fog Fabric Resource Exposure Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-eff-incperm-9E6h4yBz - CVE-2020-26084
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-eff-incperm-9E6h4yBz 

**Integrated Management Controller Username Enumeration Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-cimc-enum-CyheP3B7 - CVE-2020-26062
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cimc-enum-CyheP3B7 

**Integrated Management Controller Authorization Bypass Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-cimc-auth-zWkppJxL - CVE-2020-26063
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cimc-auth-zWkppJxL 

**SD-WAN Software Packet Filtering Bypass Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-cedge-filt-bypass-Y6wZMqm4 - CVE-2020-3444
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cedge-filt-bypass-Y6wZMqm4 

**AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-anyconnect-file-read-LsvDD6Uh - CVE-2020-27123
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-anyconnect-file-read-LsvDD6Uh 

# CVEs

- A complete list of CVEs can be found be found in the Reports section on the right.

# Recommendations

- Review the source article for full details.
- Apply applicable patches, updates, or workarounds as necessary.

# Reference

- https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/Search.x?publicationTypeIDs=1&firstPublishedStartDate=2020%2F11%2F04&firstPublishedEndDate=2020%2F11%2F05&offset=20

custom_objects.collectionWikiMarkdown:
# Summary

Cisco has published thirty-five Security Advisories. Of the advisories, twelve are rated as High, and twenty-three are rated as Medium.

# Threat Type

- Vulnerability

# Overview

Cisco has published thirty-five Security Advisories. Of the advisories, twelve are rated as High, and twenty-three are rated as Medium. For the vulnerability (CVE-2020-3556) addressed in the advisory, cisco-sa-anyconnect-ipc-KfQO9QhK, which applies to the AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client, Cisco notes it is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available. It is noted in all other advisories listed below that "The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory."

## Advisories Rated High

**AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability**
cisco-sa-anyconnect-ipc-KfQO9QhK - CVE-2020-3556
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-anyconnect-ipc-KfQO9QhK
